intro: Hiraea renidens, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hiraea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale purple or white, arranged in spikes at the tips of the branches. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
